availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Hinton (Fleming County, Kentucky, carpenter)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Hinton. Father of Edward Hinton, Katharine Hinton, James Hinton, and Jesse Hinton. Carpenter in Fleming County in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 332. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 120. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 19. Find A Grave, "Thomas Jefferson Hinton (1829-1911)," Memorial #121952819, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=121952819&ref=acom (accessed June 17, 2017).
